first_para: Nicholas Le Quesne "Nick" Herbert (born 7 April 1963) is a British Conservative Party politician and the Member of Parliament (MP) for Arundel and South Downs. He was Minister of State for Police and Criminal Justice, with his time split between the Home Office and the Ministry of Justice from 2010-2012.

full.extract:
Nicholas Le Quesne "Nick" Herbert (born 7 April 1963) is a British Conservative Party politician and the Member of Parliament (MP) for Arundel and South Downs. He was Minister of State for Police and Criminal Justice, with his time split between the Home Office and the Ministry of Justice from 2010-2012.
^ "'Equality' was said so often it became as bruised as an old peach". Daily Mail (London). 
^ "Ministers of State – Ministry of Justice". Justice.gov.uk. Retrieved 15 May 2010.
full.title: Nick Herbert
